posts.post_content: [Vow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vow) of: take your pick, she's completely become a viable Commander; multiplayer she'll be smashing around the board, but always leaving you, her master, alone. Load up the deck with the multicolor tribe of your choice (I want to make an Avatar tribal deck), or just turn her into Voltron. The only danger becomes opponents with sacrifice effects who want her dead.

Posted By: Wprundv (9/14/2011 9:36:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She HAD to have haste. If not, she would permanently be stuck in summoning sickness.   
  
Nobody would have had control of her since the beginning of their turn. Sort of like if you [mind control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mind control) something an opponent played the turn before, you can't attack with it until YOUR next turn. And if they [naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=naturalize) it on their turn, they have to wait once more. On Karona, it would never end as long as she kept getting passed around.  
  
Anyways, I like where they were going with her, but I think the fell short. Granted, creatures in her time weren't as flashy as they are today. But she needed more of a boost to hold that 'false idol' feel. Something to tempt players to try and take advantage of her, yet to be betrayed in the end. The tribal battle cry is nice and all, but falls short of "Break me!" especially with that mana cost. I know she was behind all of the insanely powerful [Decree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Decree)s (Powerful, I didn't say mana efficient) but yet,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Anyways, I like where they were going with her, but I think the fell short. Granted, creatures in her time weren't as flashy as they are today. But she needed more of a boost to hold that 'false idol' feel. Something to tempt players to try and take advantage of her, yet to be betrayed in the end. Posted By: ZeroSheep (11/30/2011 11:44:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another fun cycle to throw in her EDH deck is the Dragon enchantments from Scourge:  
[Dragon Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Breath)  
[Dragon Fangs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Fangs)  
[Dragon Scales](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Scales)  
[Dragon Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Shadow)  
[Dragon Wings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Wings)  
  
Once you have all 5 in the yard, she enters and gains all of them, becoming a 9/8 Haste, Flying, Trample, Vigilance (will rarely matter though), Firebreathing, Fear creature that pumps a tribe by +3/+3 when it swings. Practical? Hell no. Cool to watch work out in casual? Of course. Just make sure you are able to deal with the mess you've made, since you'll be passing her around once the turn is over.  
  
Bonus point if you grab them all with [Conflux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conflux) and give a long "by our powers combined" speech.
posts.html:

Posted By: SquirePath (4/2/2012 7:35:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is really cool. It's also a game winner. if not for you, your opponent. I imagine this would be most interesting in large multiplayer games however.  
  
My only real gripe with this card is that I personally feel like a being that came into existence due to [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) and [Phage the Untouchable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phage the Untouchable) should do something a bit more epic. That's just my opinion though, and I completely understand why they went with the '5 color chaos' feel.  
  
4/5 for flavor, concept, and art. Admittedly it's a card you have to build heavily around though.
posts.html:
This card is really cool. It's also a game winner. if not for you, your opponent. I imagine this would be most interesting in large multiplayer games however.

My only real gripe with this card is that I personally feel like a being that came into existence due to Akroma, Angel of Wrath and Phage the Untouchable should do something a bit more epic. That's just my opinion though, and I completely understand why they went with the '5 color chaos' feel.

4/5 for flavor, concept, and art. Admittedly it's a card you have to build heavily around though.

For clarification this will never happen ever. But it would be awesome if it did.  
  
player 1: The [Karona, False God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karona, False God) that I exiled a few turns ago with [Jhoira of the Ghitu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jhoira of the Ghitu ) resolves. posts.post_content:
It's an 8/8 with [Conspiracy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conspiracy) or if you name Avatar..  
[Vows](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vows) work, as do enchantments that force her to attack each turn (in combination) ([Furor of the Bitten](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furor of the Bitten)) for multiplayer. 3-cards down but you get to have each opponent nail eachother with a 9/9 or bigger evasive beater in chaotic style as well!  
So do creatures that tap down other creatures (usually White or Blue)

Jeska was RED

Ixidor, who's BLUE, created Akroma, who was WHITE

Boom, Karona.
